children.name: fussy
children.definition: someone who is fussy is too concerned with unimportant details of correctness, neatness, comfort etc and is hard to please: cầu kỳ
examples: ▪ My grandmother was a notoriously fussy housekeeper.
▪ Although he spent three years writing these songs, the album does not sound fussy or labored.

children.name: fussy about
examples: ▪ He’s very fussy about his drinks being served in the right kind of glass.

children.name: pedantic
children.definition: too concerned with rules and details that most people do not think are important:

children.name: mô phạm
examples: ▪ Don’t be so pedantic - does it really matter if I don’t pronounce it right?
Đừng quá mô phạm như thế - tôi phát âm sai thì có làm sao?
▪ The papers were stacked with pedantic neatness on his desk.
Giấy tờ được xếp ngăn nắp trên bàn.
▪ The booklet that accompanies the CD is informative and scholarly, without being pedantic.
Cuốn sách nhỏ đi kèm đĩa CD rất hữu ích và mang tính học thuật, mà không quá mô phạm.

children.name: detailed
children.definition: containing or including a lot of information or details: tỉ mỉ, chi tiết
examples: Her biography is clear, detailed, and illuminating.

children.name: detailed description/account/analysis etc
examples: Do you have a more detailed map of the area?

children.name: a detailed study of crime in Seattle
examples: More detailed information is available on request.
The police have issued a detailed description of the man they are looking for.

children.name: in detail
children.definition: detail all the separate features and pieces of information about sth
examples: in detail
He described the process in detail(= using a lot of details ).
Photographers need to have an eye for detail.
in detail[adverb] if you discuss or consider something in detail, you discuss or consider all the details:
in more/ greater detail
in great detail
in some detail

children.name: go into detail
children.definition: give a lot of details
examples: He refused to go into detail about what they had said at the meeting.

children.name: describe/explain sth in detail
examples: The doctor spent time describing the treatment in detail to me.

children.name: discuss sth in detail
examples: His report discusses the problem in detail.

children.name: examine/consider/study sth in detail
examples: He asked his lawyer to examine the contract in detail.

children.name: be set out in detail
children.definition: be written down and described in detail
examples: The changes to the system are set out in detail in the next paragraph.

children.name: plan/work something out in detail
examples: I haven't worked our trip out in detail yet.

children.name: great/considerable detail
examples: The subject has already been studied in great detail.

children.name: enough/sufficient detail
examples: The party was criticized for not giving sufficient detail about their proposed tax changes.

children.name: little detail
children.definition: not much detail
examples: Maps of the area showed little detail.

children.name: fine/minute/precise detail
children.definition: very exact detail
examples: We've been through all the arrangements for the wedding in minute detail.

children.name: meticulous detail
children.definition: very careful detail
examples: His books describe the mountains and their paths in meticulous detail.

children.name: graphic detail
children.definition: a lot of very clear and often unpleasant detail
examples: I didn't like the graphic detail of the violence in the film.

children.name: vivid detail
children.definition: in such a way that they seem real
examples: The three characters in the novel are described with vivid detail.

children.name: attention to detail
children.definition: care that all the small features of something are correct or nice
examples: I was impressed by the hotel's attention to detail.

children.name: an eye for detail
children.definition: skill at noticing all the small features
examples: He's a brilliant photographer with a fantastic eye for detail.
I haven’t had time to look at the plans in detail yet.
This problem is discussed in more detail in Chapter 7.
Fortunately, she was able to describe her attacker in great detail.
The layout of the house had been described to me in some detail.

children.name: elaborate
children.definition: 1having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated waySYN intricate: tỉ mỉ
examples: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
2carefully planned and organized in great detailSYN complex: kỹ lưỡng, trau chuốt
a very elaborate telecommunications network
an elaborate excuse
She had prepared an elaborate excuse for her absence.
The diaries have been published in one volume, with elaborate biographical notes by Professor Emson.
The lawyer had concocted an elaborate defence that gave a totally false impression of what happened.

children.name: blow-by-blow
children.definition: blow-by- blow informal a  description contains every detail and action of an event in correct order - use this especially when you want to say that this is boring and unnecessary: cặn kẽ, chi tiết

children.name: a blow-by-blow account/description etc
examples: You'll have to tell me about your night out with Hamish - I want a blow-by-blow account !
His memoirs are simply a blow-by-blow account of battles, and contain very little personal comment or reflection.

children.name: in-depth
children.definition: thorough, and giving as much detail as possible: chuyên sâu
examples: The committee has ordered an in-depth study of juvenile crime.
We shall be conducting a series of in-depth interviews with economic experts.
The aim of the neighbourhood studies was to obtain in-depth information from a number of selected communities.

children.name: general
children.definition: not detaileddescribing or relating to only the main features or parts of something, not the details: chung chung, khái quát
examples: The course is called ‘A General Introduction to Computing’.
This general description of the countryside oversimplifies what is really a very complicated pattern of soils and climate.

children.name: a general introduction to computing
examples: I skimmed through it to get a general impression of the text.

children.name: a general ideabasic knowledge
examples: I have a general idea of what I want to express.
This guidebook will give you a good general idea of the city.

children.name: in general terms
examples: He spoke in general terms about greater competitiveness.

children.name: rough
children.definition: not exact or complete, but with enough details for you to understand sth: sơ lược, sơ bộ

children.name: rough plan/ outline etc
examples: ▪ We’ve drawn up a rough plan but we haven’t worked out all the costs.
▪ I have not been able to do more than suggest the rough outline of this approach.

children.name: a rough ideaa basic explanation or understanding sự giải thích sơ
examples: ▪ Give us a rough idea of what you’re trying to do.

children.name: broad
children.definition: broad outline/generalization etcgiving you basic information, so that you can understand a situation, but not giving many details: rộng, bao quát
examples: ▪ Can you give me a broad outline of what the speech was about?
▪ It’s only a short course, but it’s enough to give you a broad understanding of the subject.
▪ To say that people are healthier than they used to be is a broad generalization -- the reality is a little more complex.

children.name: outline U
children.definition: outline

children.name: outline knowledge/agreement/approval etcbased on general principles, not on exact details: phác thảo, sơ bộ
examples: Students taking this course need to have at least an outline knowledge of computing.
The two leaders have reached an outline agreement on controlling short range nuclear weapons.

children.name: not go into detail
children.definition: if you do not go into detail when you are telling someone about something, you only give them the basic facts, without any details: không nói chi tiết
examples: It was only a quick explanation - he didn’t really go into detail.

children.name: vague
children.definition: something that is vague is not clear because it does not provide enough details: mơ hồ, mập mờ, lờ mờ
examples: Dave’s instructions were rather vague.
I had heard vague rumours that they were getting married.

children.name: sketchy
children.definition: not thorough or complete, and not having enough details to be useful: sơ sài
examples: It would be very unwise to change our policy on the basis of such a sketchy report.
I’m afraid my knowledge of the subject is rather sketchy.
Detailsof the accident are stillsketchy.

children.name: thin
children.definition: a piece of information or a description that is thin is not detailed enough to be useful or effective: ít ỏi, nghèo nàn
examples: I was disappointed with your history essay, it seemed a little thin in terms of content.
I’m afraid the evidence is really too thin as it stands. We need to investigate further.

children.name: particulars
children.definition: the exact details about a particular person, plan, agreement etc: thông tin chi tiết
examples: I gave him all the particulars he needed: my name, address, and the name of the hospital where I work.
You may be required togive particularsof the change in your financial position.
Forfurther particulars, contact the College secretary.
Send your particulars(= details such as your name, address, profession etc)to the address above.

children.name: particulars of
examples: The treaty was signed despite some haggling over the particulars of each country’s stock of weapons.

children.name: take down sb’s particularswrite down their personal details, for example their name and address ghi thông tin cá nhân
examples: After the police officer had taken down their particulars, the two men explained what had happened.

children.name: specifics
children.definition: all the separate facts and details about sth, especially an official proposal, contract, or statement: những chi tiếu cụ thể
examples: It ought to be possible for partners to disagree on specifics while agreeing in general terms.

children.name: specifics of
examples: Few of the specifics of James’ proposals were implemented.

children.name: get down to specificsconsider or talk about the details
examples: Now that we’ve agreed on the general principles of our policy, let’s get down to specifics.

children.name: give/go into/provide etc specifics
examples: Thurman was reluctant to go into specifics about the deal.

children.name: details
children.definition: all the smaller pieces of information that you need to know about something that you already know about in a general way: thông tin chi tiết

children.name: ask for details
examples: I went into the bank to ask for details about their student account.

children.name: send
children.definition: off
examples: for details(= write asking for information )Why don't you send for details of the course?

children.name: send your details
children.definition: send your name and address to someone in the post
examples: For a free sample, send your details to us on a postcard.

children.name: give details
examples: Our price list gives details of special offers.

children.name: provide/supply details
examples: Hotels that join the scheme provide details of their accommodation and facilities.

children.name: confirm the details
children.definition: make sure that they are correct
examples: Could you confirm the details of your reservation in writing?

children.name: disclose/reveal/release details
children.definition: make secret information public
examples: The company has refused to reveal any technical details until next month.

children.name: announce/publish details
examples: Further details of the band's tour will be announced later.

children.name: further/more details
examples: Check our website for more details.

children.name: full details
examples: The police have not yet disclosed the full details of the case.

children.name: precise/exact details
examples: Precise details of the evidence presented at that meeting have not yet been revealed.

children.name: gory details
children.definition: full details about an unpleasant or interesting event – often used humorously
examples: She wanted to hear all the gory details about Tina's date with Nigel.

children.name: personal details
children.definition: your name, address and other information about you
examples: Please make sure that all your personal details are correct.

children.name: details of/about
examples: The details of specific cases cannot be made public.
The doctor asked me for details about my eating and exercise habits.

children.name: ins and outs
children.definition: all the exact details of a complicated situation, problem, system etc: mọi chi tiết

children.name: the ins and outs of sth
examples: I don’t really know all the ins and outs of the matter.
I can’t tell you all the ins and outs of the situation over the phone, I’ll write to you next week.
I found I needed to spend quite a while learning all the ins and outs of the system.

children.name: the nitty-gritty
children.definition: the most important basic facts about sth: điểm cơ bản, cốt lõi, thực chất của vấn đề

children.name: get down to the nitty-grittyconsider or discuss the most important basic facts
examples: You’ve got to get down to the nitty-gritty: how the stage will look, what the lighting will be like, and who designs the costumes.

children.name: the nitty-gritty details/issues
examples: Kennedy immersed himself in the nitty-gritty details of the prosecutions.

children.name: technicalities
children.definition: technical details of something such as a system, process, or skill that you can only understand if you have special knowledge or training: chi tiết kĩ thuật
examples: He got a job at a printer’s and quickly learned the technicalities such as paper sizes and the processes involved.

children.name: technicalities of
examples: They discussed the technicalities of this delicate operation for some time.
Although most of us do not know much about the technicalities of surveys, we have a broad idea of what they are about.

children.name: the minutiae
children.definition: very small and exact details that are not really important: chi tiết vụn vặt
examples: Don’t get bogged down in factual minutiae.

children.name: the minutiae of
examples: He carefully recorded the minutiae of his social life in his diary.
